sentences.sContent: Smith says that some species, most famously maples, produce anthocyanin during autumn as a kind of antioxidant for trees.
sentences.sContent_eng: Smith says that some species, most famously maples, produce anthocyanin during autumn as a kind of antioxidant for trees.
sentences.sCn: 史密斯说，一些物种，例如最有名的枫树，在秋天会产生的一种抗氧化剂的花青素。

sentences.sContent: Smith said the crimson anthocyanin protects the delicate mechanisms that allow the tree to extract all the nutrients from its leaves.
sentences.sContent_eng: Smith said the crimson anthocyanin protects the delicate mechanisms that allow the tree to extract all the nutrients from its leaves.
sentences.sCn: 史密斯说，深红色的花青素保护着微妙的机制，它让树木从叶子里提取所需要的全部营养物。

sentences.sContent: The canopy pictured above gets its crimson hue from a pigment called anthocyanin, the same component that lends red cabbage its intense color.
sentences.sContent_eng: The canopy pictured above gets its crimson hue from a pigment called anthocyanin, the same component that lends red cabbage its intense color.
sentences.sCn: 图中华盖的深红色调来自一种称为花青素的色素，这种色素与红叶卷心菜的浓烈色彩有着相同的成分。
